KTJUSD has extended its closure through the end of the school year, June 18, 2020. Instruction will be provided to students. The Comprehensive Academic Plan can be found >HERE<. Meals will be provided for the week on Mondays, between 9am-10am. KTJUSD takes the threat of widespread illness very seriously. Information on preventing the spread of illness can be found by clicking >HERE< and on the CDC Website >HERE<

KTJUSD Seeking Superintendent
At their February Regular Meeting, the Klamath Trinity Joint Unified School District (KTJUSD) Board of Trustees approved a timeline and flyer outlining and advertising the Superintendent vacancy for the 2020-21 school year. Information and materials related to the vacancy may be obtained by contacting Nena Hames at nhames@ktjusd.kl2.ca.us or 530-625-5600 x1006.

Our Vision
Healthy rivers connect healthy communities, and bridges bring diverse communities together. We grow with an understanding of the past and educate for the future. Our communities are a unique part of the ever‐changing world. We motivate and teach our students to prepare for the world, yet cherish our home.
Our Mission
The Klamath-Trinity Joint Unified School District values quality education that nurtures student self-knowledge, fosters intellectual and emotional growth, promotes physical well-being, and cultivates lifelong learning.
Klamath-Trinity Joint Union School District
Fostering Intellectual and Emotional Growth
